qas.question: What opera legend also has a famous restaurant in Mexico City?
What famous Italian Restaurant also has a branch in Mexico City?
What is one of the famous Lima-based restaurants in Mexico City?
What Japanese restaurant also has a branch in Mexico City?

context: The city also has several branches of renowned international restaurants and chefs. These include Paris' Au Pied de Cochon and Brasserie Lipp, Philippe (by Philippe Chow); Nobu, Morimoto; Pámpano, owned by Mexican-raised opera legend <a0_0>Plácido Domingo<a0_0/>. There are branches of the exclusive Japanese restaurant <a3_0>Suntory<a3_0/>, Rome's famed <a1_0>Alfredo<a1_0/>, as well as New York steakhouses Morton's and The Palm, and Monte Carlo's BeefBar. Three of the most famous Lima-based Haute Peruvian restaurants, <a2_0>La Mar<a2_0/>, Segundo Muelle and Astrid y Gastón have locations in Mexico City.
